meanings.definition: Making a series of slight, sharp noises
meanings.sent1: The leaves cracklier under my feet as I walked through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The fire cracklier as more wood was added to it.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn cracklier in the microwave than at the movie theater.
meanings.sent4: The old floorboards groaned and cracklier under the weight of the heavy furniture.
meanings.sent5: The ice cracklier beneath my skates as I glided across the frozen pond.

meanings.definition: Having a surface that is rough and uneven
meanings.sent1: The cracklier road made the bike ride bumpy.
meanings.sent2: The cracklier texture of the rock made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent3: The cracklier surface of the table made it hard to write on without a mat.
meanings.sent4: The cracklier edges of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to fit them together.
meanings.sent5: The cracklier bark of the tree felt rough against my palm.

meanings.sent1: The cracklier music at the concert got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent2: The cracklier atmosphere in the room heightened the tension.
meanings.sent3: The cracklier plot twist in the movie left everyone gasping.
meanings.sent4: The cracklier competition made the game more thrilling to watch.
meanings.sent5: The cracklier colors of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues.
